Time
public final class Time extends Object

  • Constructor Details

    • Time

      public Time()
      Default constructor. It initialises a Time object and sets the default precision to 5 decimal digits.

    • Time

      public Time(int defaultPrecision)
      It initialises a Time object and sets the default precision to defaultPrecision decimal digits.
      Parameters:
      defaultPrecision - the number of decimal digits wanted in String representation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if defaultPrecision < 0.

  • Method Details

    • getTime

      public double getTime()
      Returns the time elapsed (as double) since start() was called. If start() hasn't been called yet, 0.0d is returned.
      Returns:
      a double representing the elapsed time (in milliseconds) since start() has been called.

    • hasBeenUsed

      public boolean hasBeenUsed()
      Returns:
      true if the instance has already been started and stopped.

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Returns:
      true if the instance is running, i.e. the start() method has been called, but stop() hasn't yet.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the instance at the initial state, making it possible to reuse an existing Time object. It keeps the defaultPrecision field unchanged.

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts counting time. To be used right before the job you want to compute the time it takes.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this Time instance is already runnning (i.e. start() has already been called) or if the instance has already been used (i.e. both start() and stop() have been called).

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops counting time. To be called right after the job you want to compute the time it takes finishes.

    • stopAndGet

      public double stopAndGet()
      Stops counting time (analogously to stop() and returns the time elapsed (in milliseconds) as double.
      Returns:
      a double representing the elapsed time (in milliseconds) since start() has been called.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a String representation of the time elapsed since start() was called with the number of decimal digits defined in the Time(int precision) constructor. If the zero-argument constructor was used, a default precision of 5 decimal digits is hard-coded.

    • toString

      public String toString(int precision)
      Parameters:
      precision - The number of desired decimal digits
      Returns:
      a String representation of the time elapsed since start() was called with the given number of decimal digits.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if precision < 0.
